item.title: Beyond Borders: Pechoin's Global Expansion Strategy from Malaysia to Southeast Asia
item.description:
This project represents comprehensive strategic analysis for Pechoin, a leading Chinese skincare brand. As team leader for this Oliver Wyman Impact Competition entry, I developed a data-driven expansion strategy identifying Malaysia as the optimal entry point into Southeast Asian markets based on consumer preferences, competitive landscape, and cultural alignment.

The project addressed critical business challenges through quantitative analysis of beauty industry trends and consumer data. Our strategy integrated a three-pillar brand positioning, tailored product matrix, omni-channel approach, and comprehensive supply chain solution. Financial modeling projected a pathway to $20 million in annual profits by 2030, with planned expansion to Singapore and Indonesia in years 3-5, demonstrating how systematic market analysis creates actionable strategies in competitive markets.

item.title: Machine Learning, Sentiment Analysis, and United HealthCare CEO Shooting
item.description:
Research Question: How has public opinion related to health insurance changed in the wake of the UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting?

RQ Formulated as an ML Task: In order to see how public opinion related to health insurance has changed in the wake of the UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting, we will conduct a machine learning classification task to predict whether Reddit posts have positive, negative, or neutral sentiments.

Data Collection:

  • arctic_shift
  • Raw data downloads in .jsonl format
  • Document contains dictionaries of data related to each comment, including metadata, date posted (in unicode format), username of poster, and text from the post
  • Our dataset: a dictionary mapping each unicode date (key) to its corresponding text content (value)

Data Labeling: Using a stratified sampling method, we selected a random subset of 1,000 comments for hand-labeling, which we then used to train our model.
